alert.note: Alert for Des Moines; Henry; Lee (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 26 at 7:19PM CDT until May 27 at 1:30AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: The National Weather Service in Quad Cities has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... West Central Des Moines County in southeastern Iowa... Southeastern Henry IA County in southeastern Iowa... North Central Lee County in southeastern Iowa... * Until 130 AM CDT Friday. * At 719 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Danville, Middletown, St. Paul, Lowell, Pilot Grove, Stephenson Park, Geode State Park and Camp L-Kee-Ta. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
